title: A (mostly) student-friendly food guide to Greater Boston
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Guide highlights student-friendly bars, cafes, and restaurants in Greater Boston for new and returning college students.
Recommendations include Felipe's for late-night food, Shy Bird for chicken nuggets, and Trident Booksellers & Cafe for coffee.
Non-student suggestions feature Saloon in Davis Square and Blossom Bar, aiming for more sophisticated dining experiences.

title: Massachusetts unveils finalists for state flag, motto, and seal — which gets your vote?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Massachusetts revealed three finalists each for a new state flag, seal, and motto, after over 1,150 submissions.
Finalists include flag designs with symbols like a gold star, mayflower, and turkey feathers representing Massachusetts' identity.
Public feedback will be gathered through state meetings, and final recommendations are due by December 15, 2025.

title: Mass. actually had 4 tornadoes Saturday, says National Weather Service
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Four EF1 tornadoes were confirmed in Central Massachusetts, impacting Paxton, Holden, Berlin, and Stow.
The tornadoes resulted from a severe thunderstorm causing power outages, damaged homes, and downed trees.
No tornado evidence was found in Otis and Blandford; damage assessments continue for exact track and width details.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks in September
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix adds 'The Four Seasons' (1981), featuring Alan Alda and Carol Burnett, to its streaming library.
'The Paper', a spinoff of 'The Office', renewed by Peacock despite requiring multiple episodes to hit its stride.
Apple TV+ releases Spike Lee's 'Highest 2 Lowest', a remake of Akira Kurosawa's 'High and Low', starring Denzel Washington.

title: On the hunt for sharks in Boston Harbor
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Researchers from the Anderson Cabot Center are tagging juvenile sand tiger sharks in Boston Harbor to study their habits.
The goal is to tag 40-50 sharks for a NOAA proposal; 25 have been tagged so far this season.
Juvenile sand tiger sharks stay in northern waters, like Boston Harbor, avoiding predators until colder temperatures force them south.

title: Police seek help finding alleged shooter who escaped on scooter
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Police are seeking public assistance in identifying a suspect in the Aug. 16 Dorchester shooting.
The suspect allegedly fled the scene near 326 Harvard St. on a scooter, heading towards Morton Street.
The suspect was described as wearing a white shirt, blue jeans, and possibly a helmet during the incident.

title: Best food events around Boston and New England for fall 2025
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Big E in West Springfield features diverse food options, including fried treats, baked goods, and regional specialties. (Sept. 12-28)
The Vermont Wine & Harvest Festival in West Dover offers a Grand Tasting event with over 70 vendors and a wine stroll. (Sept. 19-20)
The Damariscotta Pumpkinfest in Maine includes pumpkin-themed contests and a boat regatta with hollowed-out pumpkins. (Oct. 10-13)

title: Emmy nominee Jeff Hiller joins the latest episode of the Love Letters podcast
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Jeff Hiller, Emmy-nominated for 'Somebody Somewhere,' joins the Love Letters podcast to discuss a personal breakup story.
Hiller's story offers insights into experiencing and learning from romantic relationships during his 20s.
The episode also explores iconic breakup speeches from films like 'When Harry Met Sally' and 'Notting Hill.'

title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, pleaded not guilty to murder and kidnapping charges in Lynn District Court.
Police allege Joshua Smith made threatening statements about his sister, Michelle Knox, outside a Lynn apartment.
Court records for the case are impounded, limiting public access to details while the investigation continues.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks, four QB hits, and three tackles for a loss against the Raiders.
Despite losing 20-13 to the Raiders, Landry expressed optimism about the defense's potential and pass-rushing abilities.
New England's defense struggled with downfield plays, allowing 362 passing yards and nine plays of 20+ yards by Las Vegas.
